programme.title: 2024 US Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: 2024 US Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Countdown
programme.desc: A look at the day's college football action, featuring news, highlights and game previews.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Buffaloes host the Bison. Colorado was 4-8 in its first season under the exuberant Deion Sanders in 2023. Two-way Buffs star Travis Hunter was named a preseason All-American, while Shedeur Sanders projects to be a high pick in the 2025 NFL draft.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 16 Sooners take the field as an SEC program for the first time as they host the Owls. Brent Venables rebounded from a tough first year at Oklahoma to lead the Sooners to a 10-3 mark in 2023. Temple seeks its first winning campaign since 2019.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cardinal play their first game as members of the ACC against the Horned Frogs. Stanford competed in the Pac-12 conference and its variations since 1968. Cardinal wide receiver Elic Ayomanor was an ACC preseason first-team selection.

programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Junior quarterback Kyron Drones and the Hokies visit the Commodores. Drones accounted for 22 touchdowns, 17 passing, and 2,903 yards from scrimmage last year. The programs haven't met since 1989. Vanderbilt last enjoyed a winning season in 2013.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 4 Longhorns begin life in the SEC by hosting the Rams. Texas was voted to finish second in the conference to No. 1 Georgia in the preseason media poll. Longhorns junior quarterback Quinn Ewers was an SEC second-team selection.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 5 Crimson Tide begin life without Nick Saban as they host the Hilltoppers. Saban, who won a record seven national titles, with six coming at Alabama, retired after last season and was replaced with Washington head coach Kalen DeBoer.

programme.title: 2024 US Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Monster Milestones: Naoya Inoue
programme.desc: Japanese boxer Naoya Inoue's fight strategy is deciphered.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: The ex-champion of the two divisions of the UFC Daniel Cormier and former MMA fighter Chael Sonnen talk about their passion shared by MMA and the rest of the sport world.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The story of Michael Chang's improbable rise as a young American tennis star, and his family's immigrant journey which shaped his destiny. The story is centered around his winning the 1989 French Open at age 17.

programme.title: Monster Milestones: Naoya Inoue
programme.desc: Japanese boxer Naoya Inoue's fight strategy is deciphered.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Witness the rise of "Sugar" Sean O'Malley to superstardom with a collection of his biggest wins to date.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: Portraits: Kirby Smart

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Fever, looking to snap a lengthy slide against their foes, welcome the Sun to the Hoosier State. Since the start of 2017, Connecticut has won 22 of the 25 meetings with Indiana, including all three this season to maintain an 11-game win streak.

programme.title: Basketball Stories: Indiana Glory
programme.desc: Indiana native son Larry Bird, "Mr. Hoosier" Isiah Thomas, and all-time Pacer great Reggie Miller discuss their journey through basketball, relive their greatest on-court battles, and share memories of Indiana basketball.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: Breanna Stewart and the Liberty try for their ninth straight victory over the Sparks. New York seeks a season sweep after winning the first three games by a combined 58 points. Stewart averages 25.7 points per contest against Los Angeles in 2024.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Fever, looking to snap a lengthy slide against their foes, welcome the Sun to the Hoosier State. Since the start of 2017, Connecticut has won 22 of the 25 meetings with Indiana, including all three this season to maintain an 11-game win streak.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Lynx take another shot at the Fever in the Gopher State. Indiana escaped Minnesota with an 81-74 victory on July 14 courtesy of Aliyah Boston's 17 points, 16 rebounds and four blocks. The Fever are 2-0 since returning from the Olympic break.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The first-place Liberty start a three-game trip out west with a test against the Mercury. New York is 11-3 on the road, including a 99-93 loss to Phoenix in June. The Liberty beat the Mercury 81-78 in May behind a clutch performance by Jonquel Jones.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: Rookie sensation Caitlin Clark and the Fever try to maintain their grip on the Dream. Indiana won both meetings this season. Clark has already broken several records, including fastest player in WNBA history to reach 400 points and 200 assists.

programme.title: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Aces aim to clinch the season series against the Wings when the teams tangle in Texas. Las Vegas won the first two meetings by an average of 16.5 points per game. Aces superstar A'ja Wilson averaged 32 points and 11 rebounds in the victories.
